searchDocs.title: process​
searchDocs.content: </> darklua.process( input: typeof(stringType:type()),-- The input Lua file to process. output: typeof(stringType:type()),-- The output file where the processed Lua code will be written. config: typeof(configType:type()),-- Optional configuration for DarkLua, can be a table or a string path to a config file. spawnOptions: process.ExecOptions?-- Optional spawn options for the process execution. ) → () Processes a Lua file with DarkLua, applying the specified configuration.

searchDocs.title: convert​
searchDocs.content: </> darklua.convert( input: typeof(stringType:type()),-- The input Lua file to convert. output: typeof(optionalStringType:type()),-- The output file where the converted code will be written. If nil, the result is returned as a string. format: ConvertibleFormat,-- The format to convert the Lua code into (e.g., "json", "json5", "yaml", "toml"). spawnOptions: process.ExecOptions?-- Optional spawn options for the process execution. ) → string?-- If output is nil, returns the converted code as a string; otherwise, writes to the output file. Converts a Lua file to a specified format using DarkLua.

searchDocs.title: minify​
searchDocs.content: </> darklua.minify( input: typeof(stringType:type()),-- The input Lua file to minify. output: typeof(stringType:type()),-- The output file where the minified code will be written. columnSpan: typeof(optionalNumberType:type()),-- Optional column span for the minification. spawnOptions: process.ExecOptions?-- Optional spawn options for the process execution. ) → () Minifies a Lua file using DarkLua.

searchDocs.title: Example Usage
searchDocs.content: Example Usage local darklua = require("@pkg/darklua") darklua.process("src.luau", "out.luau", { rules = { "remove_empty_do", } }) darklua.convert("src.lua", "out.json", "json") darklua.minify("src.luau", "out.luau")
